author: mi-hol
body:
## Expected Behavior
response to prompts can be any case because PowerShell is case-insensitive by design. 
## Current Behavior
**Only on WSL and Ubuntu 18.04** prompts (i.e. for install-module) are required to be in UpperCase.
Verification details provided by @edyoung are on https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellGet/issues/314

## Possible Solution
Allow lower case response

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
```
Get-Culture
Set-Content foo.txt -Value "hi" ; $ConfirmPreference="low"; Remove-Item foo.txt
```

![2018-08-24 10_10_23-window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22799428/44573406-d1ac8200-a786-11e8-984b-40f4dbd57f1c.png)
and
![uppercasepromptrequired](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22799428/44488724-c445a980-a659-11e8-905d-40ad94bcd879.PNG)

## Your Environment
<!--- Include at least the output from $PSVersionTable -->

```PowerShell

> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0-preview.4
OS                             Linux 4.4.0-17134-Microsoft #137-Microsoft Thu Jun 14 18:46:00 PST 2018
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3

WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
and 6.1.0.rc1 https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellGet/issues/314#issuecomment-416077139
